alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Knott; Letcher; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 5:30PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Letcher, southeastern Knott, southeastern Floyd and southwestern Pike Counties through 600 PM EST... At 529 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Greenleaf, or 11 miles north of Whitesburg, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Speight, Melvin, McRoberts, Ligon and Dunham around 535 PM EST. Myra, Jonancy, Dorton, Beefhide, Buckhorn Hollow, Beaver, Shelby Gap and Adamson around 540 PM EST. Virgie around 545 PM EST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Rockhouse, Lookout, Ashcamp, Garden Village, Shelbiana, Elkhorn City, Belcher, Marrowbone, Cedarville, Mouthcard, Toonerville, Fedscreek, Biggs, Fishtrap Lake and Phyllis. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EST for southeastern Kentucky.
